summary: PEDV is a member of the Alphacoronavirus genus that has a single-stranded positive-sense RNA genome. PEDV induces diarrhea, causing high mortality in suckling piglets and weight loss in older hogs. a mucosal PEDV vaccine is not available. the gut mucosal immune system consists of immune-inductive site, such as peyer's patches (PPs), where Ag-specific immune induction occurs. the main gateway of Ags into PPs is via microfold (M) cells, specialized epithelial cells mainly found in the follicle-associated epithelium of PPs in the gut (10) tetanus toxoid can be targeted to M cells by complexing with an M cell-specific Ab (NKM 16-2-4), which interacts with (1,2)-fucose-containing carbohydrate moiety. oral administration of the complex with the mucosal adjuvant cholera toxin (CT) effectively induces tetanus toxoid-specific immune responses in the systemic and mucosal compartments (16). partial NTD gene was amplified from the S1 protein gene of the PEDV BM1 strain. the amplified gene was cloned into the pGEX 4T-1 expression vector. the protein lysate was treated with or without isopropyl -D-1-thiogalactopyranoside. immunoblotting was performed using an anti-GST Ab (Santa Cruz Biotechnology, Dallas, TX, USA) a horseradish peroxidase (HRP)-conjugated secondary Ab was added. bands were detected using an enhanced chemiluminescence detection kit.
